member.param: Number of iterations the filter will perform.
Size of the smoothing kernel used on the image.
Length of the vector field.
Increasing this variable increases parallel diffusion.
Increasing this variable decreases one-sided diffusion.
Maximum edge size at which all edge values below will be included in the operation of the filter.
The number of iterations before each consecutive update of the image.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand
member.summary: Corrects the image by removing the translation, rotation, and scaling deformations that have been applied to the image.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new ApplyTransformationParametersCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new ApplyTransformationParametersCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: The amount of image translation along the x-axis (Width). This value is divided internally by 100. This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters.
The amount of image translation (in pixels) along the y-axis (Height). This value is divided internally by 100. This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters.

Angle of rotation, in hundredths of degrees (+/-). This can be a number from 1 to 36,000. This value is divided internally by 100. A positive value means the image rotated in a clockwise rotation, while a negative value means the image rotated in a counter-clockwise rotation. This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters.

The amount of image x-axis (Width) scaling. This is a percentage value (divided internally by 100). This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters. This parameter accepts only positive values.

The amount of image y-axis (Height) scaling. This is a percentage value (divided internally by 100). This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters. This parameter accepts only positive values.
Flag that specifies the behavior when resizing the image.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this method.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this method.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.Angle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of rotation, in hundredths of degrees(+/-).
member.value: Angle of rotation, in hundredths of degrees(+/-). This can be a number from 1 to 36,000. This value is divided internally by 100. A positive value means the image is rotated clockwise, while a negative value means the image is rotated counter-clockwise. This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the behavior when resizing the image.
member.value: Enumerated value that specifies the behavior when resizing the image.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.XScale
member.summary: gets or sets the amount of image x-axis (Width) scaling.
member.value: The amount of image x-axis (Width) scaling. This is a percentage value (divided internally by 100). This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters. This property accepts only positive values.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.XTranslation
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of image translation along the x-axis (Width).
member.value: The amount of image translation along the x-axis (Width). This value is divided internally by 100. This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.YScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of image y-axis (Height) scaling.
member.value: The amount of image y-axis (Height) scaling. This is a percentage value (divided internally by 100). This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters. This parameter accepts only positive values.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommand.YTranslation
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of image translation (in pixels) along the y-axis (Height).
member.value: The amount of image translation (in pixels) along the y-axis (Height). This value is divided internally by 100. This value must be equal to the one returned from GetTransformationParameters.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand
member.summary: Removes the black borders in a 1-bit black and white image. This command is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new BorderRemoveCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.#ctor(Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveBorderFlags,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new BorderRemoveCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: Flag that determines the behavior of the border removal process.
Flag that indicates which border to remove.

Percent of the image dimension in which the border will be found. For most images, use 20. For example, if an image is 200 pixels wide, Percent is set to 20 and Border is set to BorderRemoveBorderFlags.Left, then the left border will be found in the area between the left edge of the image and a line 40 pixels from the left edge. If the border is closer to the edge of the image, use a smaller value. If the border is farther from the edge, use a larger value.
Amount of white noise tolerated when determining the border. The units are in pixels. Values of 0 to 10 are sufficient for most images.
Amount of variance tolerated in the border. If the border varies significantly in thickness, you should use a higher value for Variance. Range is 0 to 10.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this command.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this command.

member.name: E:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.BorderRemove
member.summary: Handles border information that will be removed.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.Border
member.summary: Flag that indicates which border to remove.
member.value: Value that indicates which border to remove.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that determines the behavior of the border removal process.
member.value: Value that determines the behavior of the border removal process.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.ImageRegion
member.summary: RasterImage object that is updated with a shallow copy of image that also has a region that contains the removed borders.
member.value: If BorderRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion| BorderRemoveCommandFlags.LeadRegion have been set in Flags, then when BorderRemoveCommand returns, this is updated with a shallow copy of image that also has a region that contains the removed borders. So set Flags to (BorderRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion| BorderRemoveCommandFlags.LeadRegion). It is the programmer's responsibility to dispose the region when it is no longer needed.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.Percent
member.summary: Gets or sets the percent of the image dimension in which the border will be found.
member.value: Percent of the image dimension in which the border will be found. For most images, use 20. For example, if an image is 200 pixels wide, Percent is set to 20 and Border is set to BorderRemoveBorderFlags.Left, then the left border will be found in the area between the left edge of the image and a line 40 pixels from the left edge. If the border is closer to the edge of the image, use a smaller value. If the border is farther from the edge, use a larger value.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.Region
member.summary: Gets the handle to a LEADTOOLS RasterRegion.
member.value: Handle to a windows region. When BorderRemoveCommand returns, this is updated with a single windows region corresponding to all changes, only if BorderRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion has been set in Flags and BorderRemoveCommandFlags.LeadRegion has not been set. To use this, set the Flags to BorderRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion. It is the programmer's responsibility to dispose of this region when the region is no longer needed.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.Variance
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of variance tolerated in the border.
member.value: Amount of variance tolerated in the border. If the border varies significantly in thickness, you should use a higher value for Variance. Range is 0 to 10.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommand.WhiteNoiseLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of white noise tolerated when determining the border.
member.value: Amount of white noise tolerated when determining the border. The units are in pixels. Values of 0 to 10 are sufficient for most images.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand
member.summary: Compares two images for additions, deletions, and changes and generates an image with the differences highlighted.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of CompareBitmapCommand.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this class.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this class.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a LeadMatrix object specifying how to align the modified image.
member.value: An optional transformation matrix used to overlay the modified bitmap onto the reference bitmap. The default value is **null**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.ModifiedBackground
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the background color of the `modified image`.
member.value: The color used to identify the background content within the `modified image`. The default value is RasterColor.White.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.ModifiedForeground
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the foreground color of the `modified image`.
member.value: The color used to identify the foreground content within the `modified image`. Typically, the foreground color is used to identify text. The default value is RasterColor.Black.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.OutputAddition
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the output pixel color of added information.
member.value: The color used in the generated image to indicate pixels which were background content in the `reference image`, but not in the `modified image`. Additionally, any pixels within the bounds of the `modified image` that were not within the bounds of the `reference image` will be marked with this color. The default value is new RasterColor(0, 255, 0).

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.OutputBackground
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the output pixel color of the background.
member.value: The color used in the generated image to indicate pixels which were equivalent to the background in both images. The default value is RasterColor.White.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.OutputChange
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the output pixel color of changed information.
member.value: The color used in the generated image to indicate pixels which were different in both images (but were neither an addition nor deletion). The default value is new RasterColor(255, 255, 0).

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.OutputDeletion
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the output pixel color of removed information.
member.value: The color used in the generated image to indicate pixels which were background content in the `modified image`, but not in the `reference image`. Additionally, any pixels within the bounds of the `reference image` that were not within the bounds of the `modified image` will be marked with this color. The default value is new RasterColor(255, 0, 0).

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.OutputExternal
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the output pixel color of external information.
member.value: The color used in the generated image to indicate pixels which were not part of either image. The default value is new RasterColor(128, 128, 255).

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.OutputImage
member.summary: Gets a RasterImage object that represents the comparison results.
member.value: Reference to a RasterImage object containing the comparison results.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.OutputMatch
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the output pixel color of matching information.
member.value: The color used in the generated image to indicate pixels which were equal in both images. The default value is new RasterColor(64, 64, 64).

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.ReferenceBackground
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the background color of the `reference image`.
member.value: The color used to identify the background content within the `reference image`. The default value is RasterColor.White.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.ReferenceForeground
member.summary: A RasterColor object specifying the foreground color of the `reference image`.
member.value: The color used to identify the foreground content within the `reference image`. Typically, the foreground color is used to identify text. The default value is RasterColor.Black.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.ReferenceImage
member.summary: A RasterImage object specifying the `reference image`.
member.value: Reference to a RasterImage object which specifies the reference (or original) image. The default value is **null**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CompareBitmapCommand.Threshold
member.summary: An unsigned integer specifying the equality threshold for colors.
member.value: The maximum distance between two colors that can still be considered to be equal. The default value is 0.

Array of LeadPoint structures containing mark locations.
member.returns: Array of LeadPoint structures to be filled with points which represent the center of mass for each of the supplied registration marks. The first center of mass point corresponds to the first registration mark in the markPoints array and so on_

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CoreUtilities.GetTransformationParameters(Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.LeadPoint[],Leadtools.LeadPoint[])
member.summary: Computes the rotation angle, XY scaling, and XY translation of the transformed image with comparison to the reference image. These are the transformations that would have to be performed to the reference image to have it match the current image. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: RasterImage object that references the transformed image.
Pointer to an array of reference points. These points represent the center of mass points for the registration marks in the reference image. You have to provide this information.
Pointer to an array of transformed points. These points are the center of mass points in the image. You have to provide this information.
member.returns: TransformationParameters

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CoreUtilities.IsRegistrationMark(Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.RegistrationMarkCommandType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the object inside the image is a registration mark or not. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: RasterImage object that references the image to be searched for registration mark.

Value that specifies the type of registration mark for which to look. Currently, only one registration mark is defined (T-shape). See the Comments for more information. More shapes will be added in the future.
Minimum scaling factor of mark to be detected. This is a percentage. It must not exceed maxScale, or an error will be returned. This parameter accepts only positive values.
Maximum scaling factor of mark to be detected. This is a percentage. It must not be lower than minScale, or an error will be returned. This parameter accepts only positive values.
The width of the registration mark (in pixels). This parameter accepts only positive values.
The height of the registration mark (in pixels). This parameter accepts only positive values.
member.returns: Boolean value indicating weather that specific object is registration mark or not.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CorrelationCommand
member.summary: This command compares the correlation image(or part of the correlation image) with all the areas of the same dimensions in the image to be searched (the Run method image) and finds those portions that match according to the measure of correlation. This command is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CorrelationCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new CorrelationCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.CorrelationCommand.#ctor(Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.LeadPoint[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new CorrelationCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: RasterImage object that references the image for which to search.
An array of LeadPoint structures. This array will be updated with the starting points for the correlated areas.
Step size in the X direction (along image width), in pixels. For best results, use 1. This parameter accepts only positive values.
Step size in the Y direction (along image height), in pixels. For best results, use 1. This parameter accepts only positive values.

Value that indicates the correlation threshold, which is a measure of association required to consider two areas to be correlated. If the correlation value between correlationImage and an area in the image to be searched (the Run method image) is less than the correlation threshold they are u ncorrelated. Valid values range from 0 (zero resemblance) to 100 (perfect resemblance).

Flags that indicate whether to deskew the image, which background color to use, whether to deskew the image if the skew angle is very small, which type of interpolation to use, whether the image contains mostly text, and whether to use normal or fast rotation.

member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this command.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DeskewCommand.Angle
member.summary: Amount by which the method rotates the image.
member.value: Amount by which the method rotates the image. The amount of rotation is expressed in hundredths of degrees. For example, 500 means 5 degrees clockwise. Valid values range from -2000 through 2000.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DeskewCommand.AngleRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates the maximum angle of deskew, in hundredths of degrees. This value is only used when the user set the property Flags to DeskewCommandFlags.UseExtendedDeskew.
member.value: Value that indicates the maximum angle of deskew, in hundredths of degrees. Possible values range from 0 to 4500. This value is divided internally by 100. . This value is only used when the user set the property Flags to DeskewCommandFlags.UseExtendedDeskew.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DeskewCommand.AngleResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates the deskew angle precision on which the filter is applied. This value is only used when the user set the property Flags to DeskewCommandFlags.UseExtendedDeskew.
member.value: Value that indicates the Deskew angle precision on which the filter is applied. The valid range is from 1 to AngleRange (maximum deskew angle). The real value is divided by 10. This value is only used when the user set the property Flags to DeskewCommandFlags.UseExtendedDeskew.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DeskewCommand.FillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to fill the background following rotation.
member.value: Color used to fill the background following rotation. This is used only if DeskewCommandFlags.FillExposedArea is set in the Flags property.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DeskewCommand.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets flags that indicate whether to deskew the image and which background color to use.
member.value: Flags that indicate whether to deskew the image, which background color to use, whether to deskew the image if the skew angle is very small, which type of interpolation to use, whether the image contains mostly text, and whether to use normal or fast rotation.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DiscreteFourierTransformCommand
member.summary: Computes the Discrete Fourier transform of an image or the Inverse Discrete Fourier transform as specified by the flags.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DiscreteFourierTransformCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new DiscreteFourierTransformCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DiscreteFourierTransformCommand.#ctor(Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FourierTransformInformation,Leadtools.LeadRect,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new DiscreteFourierTransformCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: FourierTransformInformation structure. The Data property of the FourierTransformInformation object is a two-dimensional array that holds the frequency components of the image. Its size must be the same as the image. This array is filled by the command when DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags.DiscreteFourierTransform has been set, and it must be sent to the command to construct the image from it when DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags.InverseDiscreteFourierTransform has been set.

Specifies the frequency range to be computed when DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags.InverseDiscreteFourierTransform flag is set. It specifies the frequency range that will be used in the image construction when DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags.InverseDiscreteFourierTransform is set. The left value refers to the minimum X harmonic, the right refers to the maximum X harmonic, the top refers to the minimum Y harmonic and the bottom refers to the maximum Y harmonic. The maximum X harmonic equals (Width -1) and the maximum Y harmonic equals (Height -1). The minimum X harmonic equals 0 and the minimum Y harmonic equals 0.

Flags that indicate the transformation type, operation channel, frequency data type used to reconstruct the image, the clipping type, the used or computed frequencies range, the operation on the specified X harmonics range, and the operation on the specified Y harmonics range. You can use a bitwise OR ( | ) to specify one flag from each group.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DiscreteFourierTransformCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this command.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this command.

member.summary: Gets or set the flags that indicate the transformation type, operation channel, frequency data type used to reconstruct the image, the clipping type, the used or computed frequencies range, the operation on the specified X harmonics range, and the operation on the specified Y harmonics range.
member.value: Flags that indicate the transformation type, operation channel, frequency data type used to reconstruct the image, the clipping type, the used or computed frequencies range, the operation on the specified X harmonics range, and the operation on the specified Y harmonics range. You can use a bitwise OR ( | ) to specify one flag from each group.

member.value: FourierTransformInformation object. The Data property of the FourierTransformInformation object is a two-dimensional array that holds the frequency components of the image. Its size must be the same as the image. This array is filled by the command when the DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags.DiscreteFourierTransform flag has been set, and it must be sent to the command to construct the image from it when the DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags.InverseDiscreteFourierTransform flag has been set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency range to be computed when the DiscreteFourierTransformCommandFlags.InverseDiscreteFourierTransform flag is set.

The left value refers to the minimum X harmonic, the right refers to the maximum X harmonic, the top refers to the minimum Y harmonic and the bottom refers to the maximum Y harmonic. member.returns: String that contains the name of this class.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.CheckContainerSubchildren
member.summary: Indicates whether the number of children for container filtering includes sub-children.
member.value: **true** to check the number of children in a container by recursing to lower objects; otherwise, **false** to only consider immediate children. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.CheckForTables
member.summary: Indicates whether the cells within a container should be preserved or ignored.
member.value: **true** to attempt to preserve the cell containers as children when filtering out a container; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.ColorInfo
member.summary: The colors for extraction.
member.value: The colors for extraction. The default value is **null**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.ContainerMinCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum child count for container filtering.
member.value: The minimum number of sub-objects within an object before it is classified as a container.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.Data
member.summary: Gets the extracted objects.
member.value: The extracted objects.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.DetectChildren
member.summary: Indicates whether an object hierarchy should be determined during extraction.
member.value: **true** to detect the children for each object, and output results as a tree of nested objects; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.EightConnectivity
member.summary: Indicates whether the diagonals will be considered during object extraction.
member.value: **true** to enable 8-way connectivity (diagonals); otherwise, **false** for 4-way connectivity (NSEW). The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.Flatten
member.summary: Indicates whether the final lists should store the children of an object immediately after the parent.
member.value: **true** to flatten the final lists and store the children of an object immediately after the parent; otherwise, **false** to output to a tree structure. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.IgnoreContainers
member.summary: Indicates whether to ignore the container during extraction.
member.value: **true** to ignore containers when extracting the objects; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.IgnoreLargeNoise
member.summary: Indicates whether a large noise should be ignored during extraction.
member.value: **true** to ignore the large noise when extracting the objects; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.IgnoreSmallNoise
member.summary: Indicates whether a small noise should be ignored during extraction.
member.value: **true** to ignore small noise when extracting the objects; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.LargeNoiseThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold for large noise.
member.value: The threshold for the large noise. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.MaxObjectCount
member.summary: The maximum number of objects to extract.
member.value: The maximum number of objects to extract. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.Outline
member.summary: Indicates whether the ExObjObject.Outline should be populated during extraction.
member.value: **true** to populate the ExObjObject.Outline property during extraction; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.ReportIgnored
member.summary: Indicates whether the ignored objects should be returned after extraction.
member.value: **true** to return the ignored noise/containers in their respective lists; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.ROI
member.summary: The region of interest for extraction.
member.value: The region of interest for extraction. The default value is LeadRect.Empty.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.SmallNoiseThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold for small noise.
member.value: The threshold for small noise. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.SortTopLeft
member.summary: Indicates whether to sort the top-level lists.
member.value: **true** to sort the result lists after extraction; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.TableMaxBorderPercent
member.summary: The maximum percentage of black pixels for a container to be considered a table.
member.value: The maximum percentage of black pixels (calculated by the area of bounding rectangles) for a container to be considered a table. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.TableSizeThreshold
member.summary: The minimum pixel size for a container to be considered a table.
member.value: The minimum pixel size for a container to be considered a table. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.UseMultiColors
member.summary: Indicates whether object extraction should be performed for multiple colors instead of bitonal.
member.value: **true** to extract objects for each specified entry in ColorInfo; otherwise, **false** for bitonal extraction. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ExtractObjectsCommand.UseROI
member.summary: Indicates whether extraction is limited to the ROI.
member.value: **true** to restrict extraction to the ROI; otherwise, **false** for the whole image. The default value is **false**.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FastFourierTransformCommand
member.summary: Computes the Fast Fourier Transform of an image or the Inverse Fast Fourier Transform as specified by flags.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FastFourierTransformCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new FastFourierTransformCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FastFourierTransformCommand.#ctor(Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FourierTransformInformation,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FastFourierTransformCommandFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new FastFourierTransformCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: FourierTransformInformation structure. The Data property of the FourierTransformInformation object is a two-dimensional array that will hold the frequency components of the image. Its size must be the same as the image. The command will fill the array elements using data from the Run method image when the FastFourierTransformCommandFlags.FastFourierTransform flag is set. The command will use the array values and reconstruct the Run method image when the FastFourierTransformCommandFlags.InverseFastFourierTransform flag is set.

Flags that indicate the transformation type, operation channel, frequency data type used to reconstruct the image, and the clipping type. You can use a bit-wise OR ( | ) to specify one flag from each group.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FastFourierTransformCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this command.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this command.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FastFourierTransformCommand.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets flags that indicate the transformation type, operation channel, frequency data type used to reconstruct the image, and the clipping type.
member.value: Flags that indicate the transformation type, operation channel, frequency data type used to reconstruct the image, and the clipping type. You can use a bit-wise OR ( | ) to specify one flag from each group.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FastFourierTransformCommand.FourierTransformInformation
member.summary: FourierTransformInformation structure. The Data property of the FourierTransformInformation object is a two-dimensional array that will hold the frequency components of the image.
member.value: FourierTransformInformation structure. The Data property of the FourierTransformInformation object is a two-dimensional array that will hold the frequency components of the image. Its size must be the same as the image. The command will fill the array elements using data from the Run method image when the FastFourierTransformCommandFlags.FastFourierTransform flag is set. The command will use the array values and reconstruct the Run method image when the FastFourierTransformCommandFlags.InverseFastFourierTransform flag is set.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FrequencyFilterCommand
member.summary: Filters the frequency harmonics data produced by a Fourier Transform method using a range rectangle.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.FrequencyFilterCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new FrequencyFilterCommand class object with default parameters.

member.summary: Initializes a new FrequencyFilterCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: FourierTransformInformation structure. The Data property of the FourierTransformInformation structure is a two-dimensional array holding the frequency components.

Specifies the filter dimension that will be applied, it represents the frequency range to be kept or removed. The left value refers to the minimum X harmonic, the right refers to the maximum X harmonic, the top refers to the minimum Y harmonic and the bottom refers to the maximum Y harmonic. The maximum X harmonic equals Width -1 and the maximum Y harmonic equals Height -1.
Flags that indicate the operation to be performed on the specified X and Y harmonics ranges. You can use a bit wise OR ( | ) to specify one flag from each group.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand
member.summary: Converts a 1-bit, 4-bit, 8-bit, 16-bit, 24-bit, or 32-bit image to a halftoned image, with a specified pattern rotation. A halftoned image is a 1-bit image that has been dithered for black and white printing or display.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new HalfToneCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand.#ctor(Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommandType,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterImage)
member.summary: Initializes a new HalfToneCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: Value that indicates the type of halftoning to perform.

The angle of rotation, expressed in hundredths of degrees. A value of 0 produces a horizontal halftone pattern. This parameter specifies the number of degrees to change the pattern. Positive values rotate the pattern clockwise; negative values rotate the pattern counterclockwise. This value is ignored if the selected halftone pattern is HalfToneCommandType.Rectangle, HalfToneCommandType.Circle or HalfToneCommandType.Random or HalfToneCommandType.UserDefined.

Value that indicates the size of the grain. This value is ignored if the selected halftone pattern is HalfToneCommandType.View or HalfToneCommandType.Print. If the pattern is not HalfToneCommandType.View or HalfToneCommandType.Print, dimension should be >= 1. If this parameter is < 1 this command will return ERROR_INV_PARAMETER.
List of images that will be used in half toning if the HalfToneCommandType.UserDefined option is selected.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this command.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this command.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand.Angle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of rotation.
member.value: The angle of rotation, expressed in hundredths of degrees. A value of 0 produces a horizontal halftone pattern. This property specifies the number of degrees to change the pattern. Positive values rotate the pattern clockwise; negative values rotate the pattern counterclockwise. This value is ignored if the selected halftone pattern is HalfToneCommandType.Rectangle, HalfToneCommandType.Circular, HalfToneCommandType.Random or HalfToneCommandType.UserDefined.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand.Dimension
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the size of the grain.
member.value: Value that indicates the size of the grain. This value is ignored if the selected halftone pattern is HalfToneCommandType.View or HalfToneCommandType.Print. If the pattern is not HalfToneCommandType.View or HalfToneCommandType.Print, Dimension should be >= 1. If this property is < 1 this command will return ERROR_INV_PARAMETER.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of halftoning to perform.
member.value: Value that indicates the type of halftoning to perform.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfToneCommand.UserDefinedImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of images that will be used in half toning if the HalfToneCommandType.UserDefined option is selected.
member.value: List of images that will be used in half toning if the HalfToneCommandType.UserDefined option is selected.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfTonePatternCommand
member.summary: Creates a halftone screen effect for an image while keeping its continuous range of tones. This method is available in the Document/Medical toolkits.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfTonePatternCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new HalfTonePatternCommand with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfTonePatternCommand.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterColor,Leadtools.RasterColor,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfTonePatternCommandType)
member.summary: Initializes a new HalfTonePatternCommand with explicit parameters.
member.param: Halftone pattern contrast. Increasing this value increases the pattern brightness, making it more visible.

Halftone pattern frequency. Internally, this value is divided by 100. For example, if ripple = 200 the actual frequency is 2. Increasing this value increases the number of dots, lines, etc. in the pattern.
Angular pattern contrast. Increasing this value increases brightness of the "spokes" in the image.
Angular pattern frequency. This value determines how many "spokes" appear in the image.
Angular pattern offset in hundredths of degrees (+/-). A positive value will rotate the screen clockwise, while a negative value will rotate the screen counter-clockwise.
Value that specifies the foreground color for any exposed areas.
Value that specifies the background color for any exposed areas.
Value that indicates which halftone pattern type to use.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfTonePatternCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this method.
member.returns: string that contains the name of this method.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the amount of angular pattern contrast.
member.value: Value that represents angular pattern contrast. Angular patterns only occur when either HalfTonePatternCommandType.Circle or HalfTonePatternCommandType.Ellipse is selected in the type property. Increasing this value increases brightness of the "spokes" in the image.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfTonePatternCommand.AngleOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the amount of angular pattern offset in hundredths of degrees (+/-).
member.value: Value that represents the angular pattern offset in a hundredths of degrees (+/-). A positive value will rotate the screen clockwise, while a negative value will rotate the screen counter-clockwise. Angular pattern offset only occurs when either HalfTonePatternCommandType.Circle or HalfTonePatternCommandType.Ellipse is selected in type property.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.HalfTonePatternCommand.AngleRipple
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the amount of angular pattern frequency.
member.value: Value that represents angular pattern frequency. Angular patterns only occur when either HalfTonePatternCommandType.Circle or HalfTonePatternCommandType.Ellipse is selected in the type property. This value determines how many "spokes" appear in the image.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand
member.summary: Removes horizontal and vertical lines in a 1-bit black and white image.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new LineRemoveCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.#ctor(Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommandFlags,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommandType)
member.summary: Initializes a new LineRemoveCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: Flags that determine the behavior of the line removal process.

Minimum length of a line considered for removal. Lines less than this length are not removed. If the LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi flag is set, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels.

Maximum average width of a line that is considered for removal. Lines that are greater in average width are not removed. If the LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi flag is set, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels.

Height of a wall. Walls are slices of a line that are too wide to be considered part of the line. Examples of walls include a character that a line passes through or a perpendicular line. If the image contains lines that pass through characters, set Wall to be equal to or a little larger than MaximumLineWidth. If the LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi flag is set, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels.

The maximum number of wall slices (expressed as a percent of the total length of the line) that are allowed. A line consists of wall slices and non-wall slices (see description of Wall). This parameter specifies that maximum number of wall slices (expressed as a percent of the total length of the line) that are allowed. Lines that have a wall percent that is larger than maximumWallPercent will not be removed. For example, consider the line below that is 10 pixels in length, and 1 pixel in height in some places, and five pixels in height in other places.

Maximum length of a break or a hole in a line. This can be used to remove dotted lines, dashed lines, or lines that have breaks due to scanning. If the LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi flag is set, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels. This parameter is valid only if the LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi flag is set.

Amount of width change that is tolerated between adjacent line slices. If the LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi flag is set, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels. This parameter is valid only if the LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseVariance flag is set. For example, the following horizontal line is 30 pixels in length (X represents a pixel)
Flag that indicates which lines to remove.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this command.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this command.

member.name: E:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.LineRemove
member.summary: Optional delegate method for additional processing.

member.value: Flags that determine the behavior of the line removal process.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.GapLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of a break or a hole in a line.
member.value: Maximum length of a break or a hole in a line. This can be used to remove dotted lines, dashed lines, or lines that have breaks due to scanning. If LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi is set in the Flags property, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels. This property is valid only if LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi is set in the Flags property.

member.value: Maximum average width of a line that is considered for removal. Lines that are greater in average width are not removed. If LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi is set in the Flags property, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.MaximumWallPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of wall slices (expressed as a percent of the total length of the line) that are allowed.
member.value: The maximum number of wall slices (expressed as a percent of the total length of the line) that are allowed. A line consists of wall slices and non-wall slices (see description of Wall). This property specifies the maximum number of wall slices (expressed as a percent of the total length of the line) that are allowed. Lines that have a wall percent that is larger than maximumWallPercent will not be removed. For example, consider the line below that is 10 pixels in length, and 1 pixel in height in some places, and five pixels in height in other places.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.MinimumLineLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum length of a line considered for removal.
member.value: Minimum length of a line considered for removal. Lines less than this length are not removed. If LineRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi is set in the Flags property, units are in thousandths of an inch, otherwise units are in pixels.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.LineRemoveCommand.Region
member.summary: Gets the handle to a LEADTOOLS RasterRegion.
member.value: Handle to a LEADTOOLS RasterRegion. When LineRemoveCommand returns, this is updated with a single LEADTOOLS RasterRegion corresponding to all changes, only if LineRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion has been set in the Flags property and LineRemoveCommandFlags.LeadRegion has not been set. To use this, set the Flags property to LineRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion. It is the programmer's responsibility to dispose of this region when the region is no longer needed.

member.summary: Flag that indicates which lines to remove.
member.value: Flag that indicates which lines to remove.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommand
member.summary: Enhances an image's contrast, edges, and density range for use in Computed Radiography (CR), in a way that all relevant image features are rendered with an appropriate level of visibility. This command is available in the Medical toolkits.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new MultiscaleEnhancementCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommand.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new MultiscaleEnhancementCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: Fraction of contrast enhancement applied to the image. Valid values range from 0 - 10000, which are interpreted as 0 percent - 100 percent. This value is internally divided by 10000. Greater values will produce stronger contrast.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommand.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommandType,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommandFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new MultiscaleEnhancementCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: Fraction of contrast enhancement applied to the image. Valid values range from 0 - 10000, which are interpreted as 0 percent - 100 percent. This value is internally divided by 10000. Greater values will produce stronger contrast.

The number of levels that will be used for edge enhancement. Valid values are from 1 to the maximum number of levels of the image. -1 will use the default number of levels (which is 3). This option will take effect only if MultiscaleEnhancementCommandFlags.EdgeEnhancement is set in the flags parameter. Passing zero will return an error code.

The edge enhancement coefficient. This value will be internally divided by 100. Pass -1 to use the default values (which is 170 interpreted as 1.7). This option will be used only if EdgeEnhancment is set in the flags parameter. Any value (>= 0) is valid. A value of 100 will be interpreted as 1.0 and will keep the image's edges un-enhanced. Larger values will produce more visible edges. Smaller values will produce less visible edges. Practically, the enhancement levels out at 200000 (interpreted as 2000.0) - values bigger than that will not enhance the image's edges any more.

The number of levels that will be used for Latitude reduction. Valid values are from 1 to maximum number of levels of the image. You can also pass -1 to use the default level value (which is 5). This option will be used only if the MultiscaleEnhancementCommandFlags.LatitudeReduction is set in Flags. Passing zero will return an error code.

The latitude reduction coefficient. This value will be internally divided by 100. Pass -1 to use the default values (which is 140 interpreted as 1.4). This option will be used only if MultiscaleEnhancementCommandFlags.LatitudeReduction is set in the flags parameter. Any value (>= 0) is valid. A value of 100 will be interpreted as 1.0 and will keep the image's latitude un-enhanced. Decreasing latitude makes the image brighter, increasing latitude makes the image dimmer. Practically, the enhancement levels out at 200000 (interpreted as 2000,0) - values bigger than that will not decrease the image's latitude any more.
Value that indicates the type of filter used.
Flag that determines the command behavior.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommand.#ctor(System.Int32,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommandType,Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.MultiscaleEnhancementCommandFlags)

member.param: Fraction of contrast enhancement applied to the image. Valid values range from 0 - 10000, which are interpreted as 0 percent - 100 percent. This value is internally divided by 10000. Greater values will produce stronger contrast.
Value that indicates the type of filter used.
Flag that determines command behavior.

This option will be used only if EdgeEnhancment is set in the Flags property. Any value (>= 0) is valid. A value of 100 will be interpreted as 1.0 and will keep the image's edges un-enhanced. Larger values will produce more visible edges. Smaller values will produce less visible edges. member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.SelectDataCommand
member.summary: Selects a specific number of bits of an 8, 12 or 16-bit grayscale image and puts them into a mask, then colors the image depending on the mask. This can show image variances depending on user-defined conditions. This command is available in the Medical toolkits.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.SelectDataCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new SelectDataCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.SelectDataCommand.#ctor(Leadtools.RasterColor,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new SelectDataCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: Color used for showing the variances in the image.
Position of the start bit that will construct the mask. The position is a zero based number. This parameter accepts only positive values.

Position of the end bit that will construct the mask. This is inclusive (it is part of the mask). The value should not be less than sourceLowBit. You can also pass -1, which is interpreted as "highest bit" (SourceImage->BitsPerPixel - 1). This parameter accepts only positive values.

Value that indicates the threshold for showing the image variances. If the mask value is greater or equal to the threshold value then the pixel will be colored using Color. See Combine for more details. This parameter accepts only positive values.
A flag which tells how to color the output pixels:

member.returns: String that contains the name of this command.

member.value: Color used for showing the variances in the image.

member.value: A flag which tells how to color the output pixels:

member.value: Brightness factor for increasing or decreasing the brightness of the image. Valid values range from 0 - 400. If you pass 100 the brightness remains unchanged. Lower values darken the image while higher values lighten the image.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.SubtractBackgroundCommand.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets flags that indicate whether the background is darker than the foreground, and whether to show the objects without the background.
member.value: Flags that indicate whether the background is darker than the foreground, and whether to show the objects without the background. You must select one from each group.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.SubtractBackgroundCommand.RollingBall
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius (in pixels) of the ball that will roll over the entire image to determine the background.
member.value: The radius (in pixels) of the ball that will roll over the entire image to determine the background. Recommended value is 50. This property accepts only positive values.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.SubtractBackgroundCommand.ShrinkingSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the shrink size ratio used to minimize the image internally in order to increase the speed with little loss of accuracy.
member.value: Shrink size ratio used to minimize the image internally in order to increase the speed with little loss of accuracy.

member.summary: Removes the distortion in an image of a cylindrical object, as if removing a label from off of the cylinder and flattening it out.

member.summary: Initializes a new UnWarpCommand class object.

member.summary: Initializes a new UnWarpCommand class object with inputPoints values.
member.param: An array of LeadPoint structures that represent the points used for input of the distorted image.

member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this class.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this class.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.UnWarpCommand.InPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of LeadPoint structures that represent the location of the input points in the distorted image.
member.value: Array of 8 points that will be used to make the transformation. The first 4 points represent the 4 corners of the cylindrical shape. The second 2 points represent two points on the curve between the first two corners that will be transferred to the points located at the distance of 1/3 and 2/3 of the total output distance between the first two corners respectively. The last 2 points represent two points on the curve between the last two corners that will be transferred to the points located at the distance of 1/3 and 2/3 of the total output distance between the first two corners respectively.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.UnWarpCommand.OutputImage
member.summary: Gets a reference to the RasterImage that represents the output processed image.
member.value: Reference to a RasterImage that contains the processed image.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand
member.summary: Converts a 12 or 16-bit grayscale image to an 8-bit grayscale or a 24-bit RGB image. This class is available in Medical toolkits only.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new WindowLevelCommand class object with default parameters.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterColor[],Leadtools.RasterByteOrder)
member.summary: Initializes a new WindowLevelCommand class object with explicit parameters.
member.param: Value indicating the low bit used for leveling. 0 <= lowBit <= highBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).
Value indicating the high bit used for leveling. 0 <= lowBit <= highBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).

Optional 8-bit lookup table that can be used to implement a user defined conversion. For every intensity value between 0 and 2 raised to the power of (highBit - lowBit + 1) - 1 there should be a corresponding entry in the lookup table that contains an RGB quad. If lookupTable is null, the conversion is a normal shift (right or left) and the output image is 8-bit grayscale. If lookupTable is not null, the output image is a 24-bit image.
Value indicating the color order if the output image will be 24-bit. If LookupTable is null, this parameter is ignored.

member.name: M:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand.ToString
member.summary: Overridden. Returns a meaningful name for this class.
member.returns: String that contains the name of this class.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand.HighBit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the high bit used for leveling.
member.value: Value indicating the high bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit <= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand.LookupTable
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional lookup table that can be used to implement a user defined conversion.
member.value: Optional lookup table that can be used to implement a user defined conversion. For every intensity value between 0 and 2 raised to the power of (HighBit - LowBit + 1) - 1 there should be a corresponding entry in the lookup table that contains an RGB quad. If LookupTable is null, the conversion is a normal shift (right or left) and the output image is 8-bit grayscale. If LookupTable is not null, the output image is a 24-bit image.

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand.LowBit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the low bit used for leveling.
member.value: Value indicating the low bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit <= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).

member.name: P:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.WindowLevelCommand.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the color order if the output image will be 24-bit.
member.value: Value indicating the color order if the output image will be 24-bit. If the LookupTable property is null, this property is ignored.

For every intensity value between 0 and 2 raised to the power of (HighBit - LowBit + 1) - 1 there should be a corresponding entry in the lookup table that contains a 16-bit RGB quad. If lookupTable is null, the conversion is a normal shift (right or left) and the output image is 8-bit grayscale. If lookupTable is not null, the output image is a 24-bit image.
Value indicating the color order if the output image will be 48-bit. If LookupTable is null, this parameter is ignored.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags
member.summary: Enumeration that specifies the behavior when resizing the image. This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags.None
member.summary: No change.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags.Normal
member.summary: Resize normally.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags.Resample
member.summary: Use linear interpolation and averaging to produce a higher-quality image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags.Bicubic
member.summary: Use bicubic interpolation and averaging to produce a higher quality image. This is slower than Resample.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags.FavorBlack
member.summary: (Document/Medical only) Preserve black objects when making the image smaller. This option affects only 1-bit, black-and-white images, where it prevents the disappearance of thin lines. You can use a bitwise OR ( | ) to combine this flag with another one. For example, Resample | FavorBlack causes color images to be resampled, but applies the favor-black option to 1-bit, black-and-white images.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ApplyTransformationParametersCommandFlags.FavorWhite
member.summary: (Document/Medical only) Preserve white objects when making the image smaller. This option affects only 1-bit, black-and-white images, where it prevents the disappearance of thin lines. You can use a bitwise OR ( | ) to combine this flag with another one. For example, Resample | FavorWhite causes color images to be resampled, but applies the favor-white option to 1-bit, black-and-white images.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags
member.summary: Flags that determine the behavior of the Auto Binarize process.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.UseAutoPreProcessing
member.summary: Use automatic pre-processing.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.UseAutoThreshold
member.summary: Perform automatic thresholding.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.DontUsePreProcessing
member.summary: Do not perform pre-processing.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.UseBackGroundElimination
member.summary: Eliminate the background of the bitmap but keep the key features, such as text.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.UseColorLeveling
member.summary: Perform auto color-leveling.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.UseUserThreshold
member.summary: Let the user choose the threshold color value to be passed in Factor. Valid values range from 0 (black) to 255 (white).

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.UsePercentileThreshold
member.summary: Perform percentile thresholding. In this case the Factor is the percentage of black pixels at which to perform thresholding, expressed in hundredths of a percent. For example, 500 means 5 percent. Valid values range from 0 to 10000.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.AutoBinarizeCommandFlags.UseMedianThreshold
member.summary: Perform median thresholding.

member.summary: Remove the left border.

member.summary: Remove the right border.

member.summary: Remove the top border.

member.summary: Remove the bottom border.

member.summary: Remove all borders.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags
member.summary: Enumerated values that determine the behavior of the border removal process.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion
member.summary: For each border encountered by BorderRemoveCommand, if the Status is set to RemoveStatus.Remove status, the removed border is added to an internal single region. If it is set to RemoveStatus.NoRemove status , the border is not added to the single region. When BorderRemoveCommand returns, either ImageRegion or Region will reference a region that contains all the removed borders. If LeadRegion is also set, ImageRegion will be updated with a shallow copy of image that has a LEAD region that contains all the removed borders. If LeadRegion is not set, Region is updated with a LEADTOOLS RasterRegion that contains all the removed borders. When the region (either LEAD or Windows) is no longer needed, it must be disposed (either region allocated in ImageRegion or Region).

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags.LeadRegion
member.summary: When the BorderRemoveCommand returns, ImageRegion is updated with a shallow copy of the affected image that also contains a region with all the removed borders. This flag must be used in conjunction with SingleRegion. So set Flags to SingleRegion | LeadRegion.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags.CallBackRegion
member.summary: Region property is updated with a LEADTOOLS RasterRegion that contains the current border to be removed. Setting this flag lets the user create his or her own composite of removed borders by combining the regions received, if Status is set to RemoveStatus.Remove. The regions can be combined using a logical OR operator. Combining all regions received when the Status is set to RemoveStatus.Remove status results in a region identical to the region created when SingleRegion is set in Flags. For an example, refer to BorderRemoveCommand. When the region received by the Region property is no longer needed, it must be disposed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags.ImageUnchanged
member.summary: The affected image is unchanged.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags.UseVariance
member.summary: Consider border variance when performing border removal. If this flag is passed, the Variance property is used. If this flag is not passed, the Variance property is ignored.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.BorderRemoveCommandFlags.AutoRemove
member.summary: Used to automatically remove relatively wide black borders. if this flag is set, all other parameters will be ignored.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ConvertSignedToUnsignedCommandType.ShiftRangeOnly
member.summary: Shift data by adding half the range to each pixel without changing bits outside the (LowBit-HighBit) range.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ConvertSignedToUnsignedCommandType.ShiftRangeProcessOutSide
member.summary: Shift data by adding half the range to each pixel and set to zero all bits outside the (LowBit-HighBit) range.

member.summary: Flag that indicates how to process bits outside the low bit to high bit range.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ConvertUnsignedToSignedCommandType.ProcessRangeOnly
member.summary: Shift data by adding half the range to each pixel without changing bits outside the lowbit to highbit range.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.ConvertUnsignedToSignedCommandType.ProcessOutSideRange
member.summary: Shift data by adding half the range to each pixel and set to zero all bits outside the lowbit to highbit range.

member.summary: Dot matrix.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags
member.summary: Flags that determine the behavior of the dot removal process.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.UseDpi
member.summary: The unit of measure for all properties of the DotRemoveCommand is thousandths of an inch. Use the image's DPI to convert to pixels. This allows the processing of many images with different DPI. If this flag is not set, the unit of measure for all properties of the DotRemoveCommand is pixels.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.SingleRegion
member.summary: For each dot encountered by DotRemoveCommand, if the Status is set to RemoveStatus.Remove, the removed dot is added to an internal single region. If it is set to RemoveStatus.NoRemove, the dot is not added to the single region. When DotRemoveCommand returns, either ImageRegion or Region will reference a region that contains all the removed dots. If LeadRegion is also set, ImageRegion will be updated with a shallow copy of image that has a LEAD region that contains all the removed dots. If LeadRegion is not set, Region is updated with a LEADTOOLS RasterRegion that contains all the removed dots. When the region (either LEAD or Windows) is no longer needed, it must be disposed (either region allocated in ImageRegion or Region).

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.LeadRegion
member.summary: When DotRemoveCommand returns, ImageRegion is updated with a shallow copy of the image that also contains a region with all the removed dots. This flag must be used in conjunction with SingleRegion.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.CallBackRegion
member.summary: The Region property is updated with a LEADTOOLS RasterRegion that contains the current dot to be removed. Setting this flag lets the user create his or her own composite of removed dots by combining the regions received, if Status is set to RemoveStatus.Remove. The regions can be combined using a logical OR operator. Combining all regions received when the Status is set to RemoveStatus.Remove results in a region identical to the region created when SingleRegion is set in Flags. For an example, refer to DotRemoveCommand. When the region received by the Region property is no longer needed, it must be released.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.ImageUnchanged
member.summary: The resulting image is unchanged.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.UseSize
member.summary: Use the MinimumDotWidth, MinimumDotHeight, MaximumDotWidth, MaximumDotHeight properties of the DotRemoveCommand to indicate the size of the dots to remove. If this flag is not set, default values for the four sizes will be used. These defaults are as follows: MinimumDotWidth = 1, MinimumDotHeight = 1, MaximumDotWidth = 2, MaximumDotHeight= 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Core.DotRemoveCommandFlags.UseDiagonals
member.summary: Considers pixels that are diagonal as part of the dot. Consider the "speck" below consisting of nine pixels.
